alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 11:20AM CDT until August 09 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Hempstead, Lafayette and Miller. In northeast Texas, Bowie. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1117 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Over an half and a half of rain has fallen at the Texarkana Regional Airport since 10 am, with additional heavy rainfall moving into the area expected to result in minor flooding of low lying, poor drainage areas. Should this heavy rain linger across portions of the area, a Flash Flood Warning will be needed. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to in excess of 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, Hope, Wake Village, New Boston, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Mandeville, Genoa, Leary, Mount Pleasant, Patmos, Homan, Red Bank, Hervey, Piney Grove and Spring Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
